topics.title: Assignment
topics.objectives: This assignment is worth 50% of your grade for this module. The final assignment submission deadline is Sunday 10th December.

los.title: Assignment
los.objectives: As your continuous assessment for this module, you are required to design and develop a database using MySQL.

properties.credits: Dr. Rosanne Birney, Mary Lyng, WIT
properties.license: Unless otherwise stated, this work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

topics.title: On-Site Workshop: June 15
topics.objectives: In this section, you will get started with SQL through MySQL Workbench.

los.title: Installation
los.objectives: In this lab, you will install MySQL and log in to MySQL Workbench.

los.title: SQL Introduction
los.objectives: In this lab we will become familiar with using MySQL Workbench.

topics.title: 04: Enhanced ER diagrams
topics.objectives: In this section we will look at the Enhanced ER diagrams and transforming them.

los.title: Enhanced ER Modelling
los.objectives: Enhanced ER Modelling

los.title: Advanced ER Modelling
los.objectives: In this lecture you will learn about how to model and transform Weak Entity Types, Recursive Relationships, and Multivalued Attributes into a set of relations

los.title: Enhanced Entity-Relationship Modelling
los.objectives: In this lecture you will learn about how Semantic concepts are incorporated into the original ER model and called the Enhanced Entity-Relationship (EER) model.

los.title: Worked Example
los.objectives: Here we construct an Enhanced Entity Relationship (EER) Diagram for a given scenario and convert the EER diagram into a set of relations.

los.objectives: In this lecture we will look at the SQL JOIN statement for 3 or more tables and the Outer Join

topics.title: 08: Security, Indexes and Triggers
topics.objectives: This section examines topics that relate to Database Security, and introduces the concepts of indexes and triggers in the labs.

los.objectives: In this lecture we will examine issues that relate to Database Security.

los.objectives: This lecture introduces the concepts of indexes and triggers, and the related SQL syntax.

los.title: Users and Privileges
los.objectives: This lecture explains how we can create new users in our MySQL databases, and control those users' privileges.

topics.objectives: In this section, we will discuss database concurrency and transaction management. In the lab, we will create a backup of a MySQL database.

los.objectives: In this lecture, we examine the operations used to create documents and collections in MongoDB.

los.objectives: This lecture examines the syntax of the find() operation used to read data in MongoDB.
